website_summaries.verdict: A quiet-running, compact orbit sander designed for detail work, but its design may need some tweaks to resolve wobbling and control issues.
pros: We love how this sander operates relatively quietly and feels good in the hand
Users report good, smooth results with this sander
Dust collection is very good, with attachment included to switch to a shop vac hose
cons: Filter needs to be cleaned often, and dust collector can be hard to remove
Some users had problems controlling the sander
There have been reports of difficulty replacing sanding discs as well as sander stopping under mild pressure

customer_reviews.title: A SAFTY REMINDER!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this sander for many years and have been very pleased. While using yesterday, the sanding pad ( that you attach sandpaper too) suddenly cracked in half. The broken off piece flew thru the air and embedded into a nearby wall. Fortunately it did not come straight back at me. This is just another reason to ALWAYS wear eye protection when using all power tools!
customer_reviews.author: T. A. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Great product but very noisy. The cartridge filter does not filter anything
customer_reviews.text: All Bosch products are great, this is a really nice random orbit sander, at a great price. However, their marketing claims are exaggerated: - It is noisy like any cheap orbit sander. - The cartridge filter does not work, there is dust anywhere. In other words, it works as bad as any other cheap random orbit sander, do not listen to their features. Now, considering Skil, Porter-Cable, DeWalt and this, this was more attractive. It is naïve to expect anything better for that price, a truly gem such as Festool cause a fortune. So, I hooked up to a vacuum with a hose and work that way. Nothing else to expect.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and reliability
customer_reviews.text: This ROS is a terrific little machine. I got it primarily for sanding, but I've also used it for buffing out compound on gel coat and for buffing out paste wax. It's a workhorse. The velcro that's on the sanding disc is super grippy, and I've had no problems with sanding discs slipping or coming off. The cord is nice and long, and the adapter that's included for the Shop Vac hose is actually the right size. The bag it comes in is sturdy and good for storing not only the ROS but also sanding discs and buffing pads. All in all, I've been extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Totally Uncontrollable!!!
customer_reviews.text: This sander is totally uncontrollable!! Judging by the other reviews on it, I'm guessing this one is defective? I've always had good luck with Bosch tools in the past. None the less, I'm returning it. I have used several brands of orbital sanders over the years with mixed results. This particular unit is absolutely horrible. When you near the edge of the board being sanded it just pulls right off the the edge. I was hoping this sander would deliver the swirl-free surface it advertises but it is one of the worst sanders I've ever used. It's going back ASAP!!!
customer_reviews.author: Craig T Parker

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST got 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: I've been sanding floors and other things since I got this wonderful little sander. I have it hooked up to my ShopVac, so there is NO dust problem. Even after sanding for 2-3 hours straight, this great sander doesn't get warm....it just keeps on working. I love it! So why didn't I give it 5 stars? The adaptor, which they claim fits a ShopVac, does NOT work with my name brand ShopVac hose. Luckily I had an assortment of adaptors, and one of them works. Unfortunately, the one that fits is 16" long, which makes using the sander slightly awkward. I recommend this sander and would buy it again in a second.
customer_reviews.author: Kassandra

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled with Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Used sander for hours on some tough jobs sanding down walls in my garage and it worked great! Sucked up a good amount of the dust too. Other sanders I've owned used to throw all the dust into the air until the entire room was cloudy. Really happy with how it saved some mess. Just need to remember to empty the dust container when it fills. It was easy to handle on walls and ceiling... good power and maneuvered without issue. Looking forward to my next job with this sander!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan David

customer_reviews.title: For the price it’s a great sander.
customer_reviews.text: Overall a very good sander, dust collector works pretty well, I used it to remove an heavy coat of poly on a teak outdoor table, it took me a while with 60 grit first, but the wood finishing went pretty fast with 120. I sanded the table for 3 hours almost and didn’t get too much of the vibrating feeling in my hands after sanding . I have mostly Milwaukee, Dewalt and couple of Makita tools, so I hope this will be a good choice on the long run but so far so good
customer_reviews.author: Mike BK

customer_reviews.title: Rapid Removal
customer_reviews.text: I've used the Porter Cable random orbitals forever. This is much more powerful, but I would not use it on veneer. It grabs and jumps around a lot, I can't hold it steady unless I use a very light touch. Great for rapid removal, but scary for fine work. Maybe it will break in after a while. Except for this one behavior, it seems like a quality build. Also, the little dust collection box seems to really work. Anyone experience the grabbing and jumping around? Any thoughts about whether that will go away?
customer_reviews.author: David Orth

customer_reviews.title: Loved the sander
customer_reviews.text: Second Bosch Random Orbit sander I have had. First one lasted 5 plus years. This one died just after the warranty ran out. Completely stopped working. Loved the sander, can't believe this one only lasted about 13 months. I do use it a lot rehabbing furniture, but should have lasted longer given the price and the Bosch name. Will never buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: This little guy is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is fantastic. I have started doing several furniture refinishing projects and needed a good little sander. This thing fit the bill. It is easy to use, comfortable in my hand, and doesn't shake my arm to the point that I feel fatigued after I use it on large items. The dust cup does a decent job of minimizing the dust from sanding as well. I often times do some of my less intense sanding inside my house and this has made that possible without a total mess. There's still some dust in the air but nothing like there would be without the dust cup catching most of it. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HBPCP

customer_reviews.title: Pad is not flat
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was excited to receive this item. Unfortunately, the pad is not flat and moves up and down of plane. I hate returning the products, but need something more reliable that will not damage the surface of wood.
customer_reviews.author: THT

customer_reviews.title: Worked great at first
customer_reviews.text: After over a year of using, I believe I will be replacing this sander with another brand’s model. It worked great in the beginning and over the past year it started to not function as well. Primarily the disk greatly reduces spinning once placed on the surface to sand. From reviews and others I’ve spoken to, this is usual for Bosch sanders. I don’t regard it as a commercial tool, but I expected it to last longer than my inexpensive ryobi one did.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great small sander for beginers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because my small Ryobi sander had recently broke and was spinning out of control, literally. This Bosch is only 10 dollars more and honestly is far better. I was surprised at the qaulity of the tool. This isnt something you would use to hog off a bunch of material with 40grit, but it certianly does the job. I would say this is for someone who is trying to get a nice finish ready surface as well as getting some saw marks out of wood before finishing a project.
customer_reviews.author: MarkPelly

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Sander!
customer_reviews.text: I hardly ever give 5 stars, but this sander deserves it. I'm really hard on my sanders due to a lot of uneven surfaces and edges, so I've had a few. The filter on this sander is better than any bag filter - very close to dustless compared to running a dusty bag all the time. Good adhesion on the pad - I had a DeWalt that would let disks fly off way too quick - this sander holds onto disks until you're ready to put on a new one. The variable speed is great - can't believe I did without it until now. And, it's the quietest sander I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: CO

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sander
customer_reviews.text: I've owned 3 different DeWalt orbital sanders (both variable and non-variable speeds) and while they did the job they all seemed loud and vibrated a lot. I accepted it as a norm and never knew something else could exist. I just got this sander and what an amazing difference this one is. It is so much quieter and so much smoother. It almost does not feel like its doing anything. I had to lift to see and check several times. there is also practically no dust. The box is rather small but it does much better job at collecting the dust. I cannot even imagine what Festool must feel like but this sander is excellent for me!
customer_reviews.author: ValVe

customer_reviews.title: Best Sander I've Ever Had !!
customer_reviews.text: Best orbital sander I've ever had ... Does an amazing job, you can get extra sand pads at Home Depot under the red Diablo brand, they fit perfectly. That plastic container at the back sucks up all the dust so you don't have to breath it. Make sure you align the holes in the sanding pad with the holes in the sander. Amazing, five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Herb H

customer_reviews.title: This is one of the best dual action orbital sanders for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best dual action orbital sanders for the money. Works almost as good as a Festool at a fraction of the cost. The unit comes with an attachment for a vacume but I don't use it as the dust collector can works very well on its own. The speed could be a little batter on the higher end but the low speed is where this shines. Very controllable. My only real gripe is the durability of the dust collection can. This fell off my work bench the first week and the can cracked open and was unsalvagable. Th replacement collector was $30.
customer_reviews.author: john wallace

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. When I found out that there’s a palm sander with an adjustable speed, I looked for it right away on Amazon and found this unit. I used it all day yesterday as we were re-staining the deck and replaced the hand rails. My wrists were fine unlike that time when I used my husband’s palm sander (not sure what brand it is). I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ethel Thrift

customer_reviews.title: Lost its function after a few test runs.
customer_reviews.text: I grew up in a construction company. We used pretty much exclusively Bosch. So, I have had a good memory of all these tools. The Sander is different. The Pad that holds the sanding discs lost its grip after a few little uses. The sanding disc moves to the side and then disconnects totally. This is not anything that I have seen in my life before. An accidental "lemon"? I will see if I can find a reasonably priced replacement, but I think this was a bad start, and I will send it back. Too sad.
customer_reviews.author: Visual Artists.

customer_reviews.title: The Bosch sander is a nice unit with low noise and little vibration
customer_reviews.text: The Bosch sander is a nice unit with low noise and little vibration. Very nice sander to have in the shop. Be careful buying this unit on Amazon, many sellers are pushing their refurbished units and not clearly marking their adds in such manner. I made this mistake. And is cost me 20 dollars to shipping cost to return. Good luck sanding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It gets lots of use and does a great job
customer_reviews.text: I have used this a lot this year with my wife's craft projects. It does a great job. You have to empty the dust bin or the pad will get dusty and stop sticking to the Velcro. I ordered the firmer backing pad (RS035) and it sped up the bigger flat projects. Before we got this orbital sander I had been using the sander tips on my Rockwell Sonicrafter since our mouse sander only worked for very small jobs. This is a big improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Goodman

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TOOL
customer_reviews.text: This random orbital sander kit a great tool especially for a beginner like me. It is light and easy too handle. The dust pt and collector works very well. I have only used it a few times but my wood has turned out smooth with no issues. The carrying case is very convenient to have. I am no expert on tools but as a novice I am pleased with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: rjg

customer_reviews.title: Sander is #1 A-OK.
customer_reviews.text: I had 1/4 sheet sanders before, a Ridgid one which ended up being useless because the plastic parts that keep the sand paper on got worn out and won't hold paper anymore and a porter cable one. I can highly recommend the porter cable 1/4 sheet sander. I also highly recommend this Bosch Random Orbital Sander. The little dust collection thing works well and if hooked up to the shop vac well that's even better. I'll probably reach for this over the1/4 sheet sanders.
customer_reviews.author: gordon

customer_reviews.title: I like it. The machine works like all the other ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it. The machine works like all the other Bosch tools that I own, smooth & seemingly effortlessly. The dust bag, which I use when I am not able to hook the sander up to a vac, is the best I have come across. BUT, one MUST remember to empty the dust collector often. The collector works so well that it fills up rather quickly. It helps to READ, HEED & FOLLOW the owners manual.
customer_reviews.author: MAKA PO

customer_reviews.title: Top Choice for 5" Random Orbital Sander
customer_reviews.text: The ergonomic hand grip makes this sander easy to hold and use. The pad dampening system eliminates swirl marks that my old ROS always left behind. Dust collection is extraordinarily efficient because of the micro filter system. No dust escapes this sander making it a pleasure to use compared to my old ROS that always left a lot of dust behind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bosch ROS20VSC Palm Sander Gets The Job Done, Excellent Dust Control, Quiet Operation
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet operations, low vibrations on your hands, easy to control. Very quiet operation, no need for ear plugs. Excellent job removing wood for a smooth finish. Dust collection system is exceptional. Filter fills up faster than you think, check it often. Nothing I do not like about this sander. I have two other pad sanders, this one is my "Go To" sander when there is quality finish work to be done.
customer_reviews.author: Al Allen

customer_reviews.title: one of the best if not the best random orbit sanders i have found for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what I did before I bought this random orbit sander, this makes finishing so much quicker, and with the dust collection adapter allows me to tap into my shop dust collection system leaving absolutely no dust behind, especially since it has an 8 hole dust port design instead of 5 like many other sanders that I looked at when purchasing. it is also extremely easy to adjust the speed on the fly and easy on off switch is something that cannot be overlooked
customer_reviews.author: Hopper55

customer_reviews.title: Great things sometimes do come in small packages
customer_reviews.text: I love this little guy. I've never actually bought a sander new, the local pawn shop seems to always have them- but man I've been missing out. The sanding action is great, the feel of the handle is awesome, and the pad is soft enough to give a little cushion between you and the workpiece. Its built in such a way that makes it easy to use with either hand, and you can hold it several different ways. Super happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas W.

customer_reviews.title: Good for finish work, not so good for rough work
customer_reviews.text: We bought this after reading some reviews. We need a sander to do multiple jobs and this seemed like a good one. I give it 4 stars because after using it on several different applications, I feel it is best suited to finish sanding and just doesn't have the power to really do a good rough sanding even with the right grit of paper. We ended up also purchasing a belt sander that does a better job of sanding a rough wood down.
customer_reviews.author: Mark McLelland

customer_reviews.title: Nifty Lil Sander
customer_reviews.text: Update: Pleased with the ease of operation and the finished product without swirl marks is a plus. Plenty of power and the pad is flat unlike some other reviews. Maybe Bosch corrected this issue or I received a good one. I see the oring for the dust collector failing rapidly due to the on/off for such a small canister. I'll hook mine to my shop vac anyway, but Bosch should include an extra oring instead of a 80 grit disc. Overall pleased with this ROS.
customer_reviews.author: randy w.

customer_reviews.title: Received sander.  Cranked it up and it doesnt work.
customer_reviews.text: Got this sander with great expectations. Cranked it up and the motor runs fine but the sander base doesnt turn at any speed adjustment. I can put my hand on it and go to sleep as it just doesnt work.
customer_reviews.author: Jeger

customer_reviews.title: Tried every single way to get this to operate smoothly and it was still pulling all over the place
customer_reviews.text: I wanted the best sander I could get for the best price. Did some research and despite being advised that this sander was jumpy I got it anyway. Don't ask why because it was stupid. I liked the style and the ergonomic handle and the thought of a Bosch tool. But just as woodworking reviews and other sites I searched stated this machine is not smooth even working with the speed controls, paper grit and different wood types, no pressure diff pressures... That pretty much sums it up!
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Gal

customer_reviews.title: Works very good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good review. It is much quieter than most models. I have an outside workshop. The further away from my wife the better. My close neighbor is a knuckle head. Complains about the noise, so I bought a train horn. That works good to. I like the Bosch, it’s very quiet and works just as well as my other sanders, even better. GOOD job Bosch. I also love your big router.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K. Fakowi Tribe

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several palm sanders before this one. This being the first time I invested more than 25 bucks into one. I must say it’s definitely worth it. You can really feel the quality of it when its running. Plus the variable speed setting is something ive never had before and has been enjoyable to take advantage of. This is the only palm sander I will own from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: There are better options
customer_reviews.text: I had this sander for many years and it finally gave out. Bought the dewalt model and found it to be significantly better. Figured the difference was just that my old bosch was worn down. Dewalt was stolen after a few months and i bought the bosch to replace. New dewalt beat the new bosch easily in my view and I am partial to bosch tools.
customer_reviews.author: B. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Love This Sander!
customer_reviews.text: My old POS Dewalt (AKA Black & Decker) sander finally died and I wanted to replace it with a good one instead. This sander is wonderful. The variable speed is nice, but the nicest part is that this machine is very quiet, even at top speed. It also does a really good job of catching the dust. Even after fairly prolonged use there is no haze of dust in the air -- most unusual.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product for med-high use. Buy something commercial grade for larger projects that require extensive sanding (30min+ constant sanding). Product will get hot and not start back up until cooled down. Will work beyond expectations for any home/personal shop use.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Womack

customer_reviews.title: Needs be broken in?
customer_reviews.text: Still catches and wobbles. Must go through a number of them before you find that one that is operator friendly. While I like Bosch, I have nothing good to say about this sand, EXCEPT. I have had one since 2002 and it is easy to opoerate and has never failed me with thousands of hours of work. Maybe they just need to be broken in.
customer_reviews.author: capnjohn

customer_reviews.title: Great sander
customer_reviews.text: I'm a contractor and I love this sander. This was the second one I purchased. My father kept borrowing it so I ordered him one. The variable speed is great for delicate surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Brian & Kris Smotherman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I’ve put this sander through 40+ hours of work over the past few weeks and it has held up quite nicely. I have large hands and the grip is a little small for me but that’s a minor annoyance. The dust collector works surprisingly well but fills up very quickly depending on what grit paper you’re using. The sander feels sturdy and high quality overall.
customer_reviews.author: G Mane

customer_reviews.title: Good luck with the dust canister!
customer_reviews.text: Giving this a 3 star not because the sander is inefficient but strictly because the dust collector cup is either defective or it is just designed so poorly that I can't get it back on after I dump it. I have watched YouTube and read instructions and it looks like a breeze but it is not the case. I wish there was more customer service with these products!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: 1A to a Festool Orbital Sander.
customer_reviews.text: To put it simply, for the money, your not getting a quality product this good unless you fork over the $200 for the Festool. The vibration and sound are extremely low, I've used super cheap pads and still have never had a single swirl in months of use. Also, the dust collector is top notch and when the sander is hooked up to my shop vac, there is not a single spec of dust, anywhere, ever. Seriously, no matter what iam sanding, no dust, ever. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael V.

customer_reviews.title: but all in all very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a few weeks now sanding rough 2x4 framing lumber. rather impressed, granted i am a novice, but still the dust collector works well, i did shim between the collector and the sander body to reduce the vibration, but all in all very happy with this, the variable speed is really nice. I've been changing disks quite often, and so far the pad has not shown any signs of losing its gripping power. For the price, well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Hettel

customer_reviews.title: Great product and value.
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best sander I've used. Pros: Noise level is average Low vibration Good design and craftsmanship Cons: I connect to my shop vac for a no cleanup application, and I feel the connection port could be a little more snug, maybe an o ring would do it. Overall don't hesitate to buy this Sander.
customer_reviews.author: S. Nahid

customer_reviews.title: A Sander I can Commit to....
customer_reviews.text: VERY happy with this sander! Built well, AWESOME features (variable speed, protected switch, soft grip, and dust collection / vacuum attachment) low vibration (which will save the nerve endings in your hands and fingers)....couldn't ask for more. I had a sheet sander that buzzed my hands off and it went STRAIGHT back.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This sander has been a real waste of time and money for me. I have been using random orbital sanders for 20 years and this is the worst I've ever had. Wonder if I got a dud. As soon as you put the sander onto the wood board it stops spinning. Didn't contact the company because I did not feel like going through the Litany of ridiculous questions about using the sander incorrectly. Companies seem to always want to blame the user and not they're inferior product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Works great, not too loud. I’ve used the heck out of it and the dust catcher keeps my garage from being covered in dust.
customer_reviews.author: cld

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sander with Variable Speed a must for wood working
customer_reviews.text: This sander is awesome. I had a black and decker orbital sander prior and it was hard to control and the speed was so fast it would marr the wood when applied. This one is much easier to control with the variable speed dial. The velcro pad is compatible with all my existing hook and loop sanding pads. The carrying bag is a nice addition, big enough to hold sander and all the sanding pads you would need. It does come with only one 80 grit sandpaper, would have been nice if it came with several other grits, but you can pick them up and so far diablo, masterforce, and performax have worked with mine.
customer_reviews.author: plantar fascia runner

customer_reviews.title: Great all around.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this sander for a few weeks now. Tackled some drywall blemishes, stripped and handed sanded the deck and smoothed it off with this guy and some small wood working project. Great sander to have around. The variable speeds are nice as is the padding on the bottom, easy sandpaper changeout, and comfortable grip. The only thing weird is that the dust trap is sometimes a pain to get open and empty out.
customer_reviews.author: Otter11

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this one!
customer_reviews.text: I love this variable speed random orbit sander! Very well balanced, powerful and yet not as loud as other brands. I looked at a lot of sanders on the market and zeroed in on this one. Very happy I purchased this Bosch sander. It will probably be the last sander I will ever need. Great features and high quality make a good combo.
customer_reviews.author: The AngelArs Foundation

customer_reviews.title: Great Performance
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easy to handle. Speed selections are more than sufficient. Cord length is adequate. Dust holder capacity is very good. The only difficulty I've had is with the dust holder. It's a bit awkward to twist on and off. Getting the cover off to empty it has also been a little frustrating. I'm a 60+ yr old woman and I would buy it again even with the aforementioned items.
customer_reviews.author: Northern Gal

customer_reviews.title: We use this on probably over 4 pallets now and it does great!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought this product as a lightning deal. We were wanting to do some pallet projects and needed a decent sander. We use this on probably over 4 pallets now and it does great!!! As long as you get the right sand paper and the wholes aligned it will catch most of the dust. We could deffinately tell a difference with the amount of dust with the correct sand paper it can with that matched it and the refills we bought that didnt match. Would definitely recommend this sander!
customer_reviews.author: Saphrin

customer_reviews.title: Very Good for basic finish sanding
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice unit and does an excellent job at basic finish sanding. It does not have the guts for tearing down levels of paint of hard old finishes - there is too much oscillation and not enough rotation. I would buy it again if I needed another 'finish' sander.
customer_reviews.author: RickB

customer_reviews.title: Sands great, but the trap is the worst!!!
customer_reviews.text: This works great, but the design of the trap is awful!!!! I can barely it it open and shut again. I wouldn’t buy it again unless they redesign it. I waste 10 minutes just trying to empty it and snap it back together again.... every time! It’s very stiff. If you made the trap with a more pliable plastic it would be way better!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Decent product for straight sanding
customer_reviews.text: This is really great for projects done indoors because it can hook up, universally, to any vacuum. Also, it's super easy to grip and move around. As someone who refurbishes furniture, the only downside for me was that it didn't have an angle to get into corners as it's completely round.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought it sooner
customer_reviews.text: I'm refinishing all of the trim and interior doors in my house. That's a lot of sanding, so I was looking for an upgrade over the quarter-sheet palm sander that I had been using. This kit was worth every penny, and more. It is the quietest sander I've ever used, powerful, comfortable, and the vacuum adapter fits right into a standard 1.25" Shop Vac hose. If I could make one improvement, I'd like to see the dust filter redesigned to use a cheap, easily replaceable element, but that's a very minor issue for me. In hindsight, I can hardly believe that I ever thought those loud, hand-numbing, dust-flying, cheapo sanders were ever a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: the best orbital sander I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is at the higher end of the price curve, but it's also, by far, the best orbital sander I've ever used. Prior to this I was using a black and decker entry level sander and the Bosh ROS20VSK blows it out of the water. With low grit paper you can get away with not planing, which is great, and high grit paper leaves wood as smooth as a baby's bottom after a half dozen passes. I took a tabletop made of construction grade lumber from rough to 150 grit finished in about 45 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This is like my third or forth one. I use it for custom cabinetry. These tend to disapper on the job site. I've never had one fail and I use it alot. The dust collector actually works for most but not all the dust. The Bosch random orbital 5" sander is the bee's knees. I'd be lost without it close by.
customer_reviews.author: Sotto voce

customer_reviews.title: Sooooo glad I bought this sander
customer_reviews.text: Sooooo glad I bought this sander. It has held up great. I hook up my shop vac, and the pads seem to almost never load up, as the suction through this tool is great. It is powerful, and can get a job done faster than I thought I could. Also the vibration is not as bad as a lot of other sanders I have used over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Derek R.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Did several bathroom cabinet refinishes with it and it saved tons of time.
customer_reviews.author: GeekParrot

customer_reviews.title: Nicely designed, works well, not too loud
customer_reviews.text: My first orbital so nothing to compare with, but I'm really happy with it. Not very loud. I use with dust collector that works very well, and I also have taped it to my shopvac, I guess I should have an adapter but duct tape worked as well. Really worth it, having dust collector is HUGE and the only way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Cassey

customer_reviews.title: I love the variable speed feature of this sander
customer_reviews.text: I love the variable speed feature of this sander. It allows you to dial in the speed to cause less than "hand-shattering" vibrations... unlike my old inexpensive palm sander. The hook and loop fasteners on the sanding disks are a very nice touch, making it so much easier to switch between various grits. Honestly, the thing I like the best about this is how quiet it is when running. Sure, you can "crank it to 11" and get it to really cut in, but for most jobs, dialing back the speed a little gives a nice quiet hum, that's far easier on the ears.
customer_reviews.author: Darran

customer_reviews.title: It does a great job of collecting the dust
customer_reviews.text: I used this to clean up some rough cut cedar. It does a great job of collecting the dust. I upgraded from a Harbor Freight one and it is significantly better at dust collect. The sanding seems about equal, although my 6 year old Harbor Freight one clearly was showing its age and was ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: A. Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Well built, good case.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last week and used it for the first time today. It does come with a very nice hard case. The sander looks well build and came with a dust container as well as a hose connector if you want to hook it up to a vacuum. They did throw in one disc, it think it's 80 grit. Functionally I like it. Very smooth motor. Nice even job of sanding. I like the the variable speed. The on and off toggle is well positioned, but a bit touchy. Not a possibly tactile feel to on or off. But overall I like it.
customer_reviews.author: YouMaybeRightIMaybeCrzy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool!
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade from the old palm sander I had. The filter is truly impressive. I thought it wasn’t necessary but after using the sander and seeing how much the filter draws in, I changed my mind. I’m thrilled with it and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Sander
customer_reviews.text: This sander worked great for my front door project. Could not have been more pleased. I hooked up the exhaust to shop vac and did all the work inside my garage. The sanding pads stick to the sander perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: BlueSky

customer_reviews.title: not bad but not great
customer_reviews.text: I think it's a good sander for the price. I like the efficient dust collection and the sanding is pretty good. I don't have the nerve to buy a more expensive sander to test so for now this will do just fine.
customer_reviews.author: R. D. Terriere

customer_reviews.title: The Little Sander That Could
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the jimmy jam. Get one of these bad boys, connect it to your wet/dry vac, buy a pack of sanding pads and you're good to go. I've done a couple of projects with this and have come to the conclusion that it is a great tool. Well designed by people that I assume are in the trenches, actually using their tools.
customer_reviews.author: FIRE

customer_reviews.title: Really could not ask for more
customer_reviews.text: My needs in an orbital sander are fairly low-key: sanding the finish down on an outdoor table, prepping a new handrail for painting, that sort of thing. I find this sander to be very comfortable to work with, lightweight but powerful enough for the types of projects I do. Many of the sanders here on Amazon seem exclusively designed for right-handed people, so the Bosch's ambidextrous design is ideal for me. The catch canister does a decent job of collecting dust; I imagine that using the included vacuum adapter would pick up even more. All in all, this sander does everything I could reasonably ask of it. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Keflex

customer_reviews.title: On a floor refinishing project, I did the outside ...
customer_reviews.text: On a floor refinishing project, I did the outside edges in three rooms so far, after sanding them with a drum sander. Also stripped depressing walnut stain from a pair of mid-century modern Danish cabinets: 80 grit, 150 grit, 220 grit. The dust collection box works, but needs to be emptied often.
customer_reviews.author: Scholasticus

customer_reviews.title: Everything I Expected and More
customer_reviews.text: After reading a number of online reviews, I decided to purchase the Bosch ROS20VSC 5-Inch Random Orbit Sander with Carrying Bag. I used this sander to prep the surface of a banquet bench seat for our kitchen. I was extremely pleased with the sander's performance and from reading some of the reviews, I found the filter easier to remove and clean than I expected. Love the idea that the sander has it's own carry bag for both the sander and the sanding disks. The bag will help save the integrity of the sander. Looking forward to using the sander on many more projects!
customer_reviews.author: RCJackman

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Comfy and powerful. What else do you really need in a sander? I really like it and it does a good job, it replaced an old style square finishing sander (this thing is light years ahead of that old one).
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally smooth finish.
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, smooth, and such a fine sanding pattern. First project was refinishing an old door. Left a surface that was exceptionally smooth. Wish my paint work was as smooth. So... after two coats I sanded it lightly until it was smooth and put on a thin coat of clear. Think I'll keep using my DeWalt for heavier stuff, but this is perfect for that final sand.
customer_reviews.author: kris stadelman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Sand well
customer_reviews.text: This sander is unfortunately not very good at sanding wood. I haven't tried it on another material, however, my black & decker mouse sander from 2005 works far better and is easier to control.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great dust collection!
customer_reviews.text: Been buying from Amazon forever it seems, and this is my first review. Felt compelled because I love the dust collection system on this sander. I do a lot of wood work and dust is always an issue. Most tools have poor systems...and are usually some kind of bag, which is a dusty mess in itself. This system with hard plastic case is fantastic. All the dust is contained. Easy to remove. Has paper filter which is easy to clean. Oh, and the sander works really well. This is definitely one of my very best wood working purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smooth finisher
customer_reviews.text: Wow. And when I say "wow", I mean... NICE! I'm an amateur DIY guy who builds outdoor benches & this sander is great. I don't care if there are bigger, better sanders because this one gets the job done and quietly (I didn't notice my earplugs weren't in until I fired up a different sander for the same project). This sands redwood so smoothly with 320 grit discs that I almost hate to stain it afterwards. Square single-speed palm sanders have their place, of course, but this one adds a finishing touch you'll admire as it's being applied.
customer_reviews.author: O B

customer_reviews.title: Nice product - satisfied overall...
customer_reviews.text: It does a good job of sanding. Didn't notice where the speed control was until after the first use, but that's a nice touch. Not the best to use around nooks or crannies or sanding baseboards if they are still at the bottom of the wall - the design and shape and size makes that a difficult task. Does as advertised. Fair value for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Speakervictor

customer_reviews.title: Great Orbital Sander! Comes with the box and a couple initial pads.
customer_reviews.text: Stop looking for any other orbital sander. Before I purchased this item I was worried it would be hard to control because I've never owned an orbital sander but this was anything but that. Having the different grit pads allowed me to get the exact finish I wanted. The dust collector helped minimize my mess too. I used this to sand a block of concrete as I was creating a concrete coffee table.
customer_reviews.author: Eric G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent dust collection!
customer_reviews.text: Machine works well for sanding and collects dust very well. It has only been a few usage since i bought it a week ago - so i don't know the durability of the machine. Here is hoping Bosch lives up to its great reputation of dependability!
customer_reviews.author: MT-Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality and function
customer_reviews.text: Much effort and thought went into the design and function of this product. The materials fit finish are superb. Quality of these bosch tools are either great for the full time professional or casual user.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick T.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have the larger Bosch sander and this one is great to use for smaller projects. No vibration, and sands great.
customer_reviews.author: Mark & Jody

customer_reviews.title: Great dust collection!
customer_reviews.text: Love it and it collects dust really well. Can't believe I didn't have a dust collecting sander before! Even has the right size port to use with my dust collection system if I want. Probably won't though because the onboard collection and filter is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: James C

customer_reviews.title: Inconceivable Dust Collection!
customer_reviews.text: A delight to use. The front rubberised grip makes it easy to control. The operation is smooth. Best of all, the dust collection system actually works! I bought this sander because it has a vacuum adapter—it’s difficult to find the right adapters for my Ridgid shop vac—but I don’t need it. With regular emptying, the attached collector collects everything! Usually I’m a Makita man, but there are certain things that Bosch does best.
customer_reviews.author: Bart H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome orbital sander
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this sander. My old palm sander cord had worn out so I went by other reviews. This is awesome! I refinish furniture for a living & this orbital sander has just made work so much better! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Dwain Brock

customer_reviews.title: Great Sander
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my work. No swirls, streaks, or skips. Dust bin works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Good sander for woodworking
customer_reviews.text: Great sander compared to the Black and Decker I had before. It actually is smoother running with less vibration. Did not notice any swirl marks in my recent batch of doors. I tried running at different speeds (this is a variable speed model). I end up just running at high speed for finish sanding wood; it kind of grabs at lower speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Farmer Brown

customer_reviews.title: This sander is remarkably quiet and a great form factor
customer_reviews.text: This sander is remarkably quiet and a great form factor. My deduction of one star is related to the placement of the power button. When holding the front of the hand grip area, it's very easy to mistakenly move a finger and turn the sander off.
customer_reviews.author: CEOofEncom

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and functional
customer_reviews.text: This is a good performing orbital sander. There is a built in dust collector, which has enough capacity only for small jobs. For heavier use, the dust port readily fits hoses to connect to a shop vac or other dust collection system you may have.
customer_reviews.author: Theo.L

customer_reviews.title: Possibly the most important tool I own
customer_reviews.text: I have had this sander for two years. I make and sell wood toys from small trains to rocking horses as well as non-toys like a porch swing from rough cedar. This tool is possibly the most important tool I own. It is easy to handle, versatile with multi-speed and the hook-and-loop disc attachment works perfectly. I use it for sandpaper 60 grit to 220 grit and the combination of speed and grit gives the perfect result. The dust collector even works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Quality and results
customer_reviews.text: I can only echo other users' reviews. It is comfortable to use, produces great results, and does a remarkably good job of collecting dust. I am able to use it inside my garage with only light vacuuming to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Peter West

customer_reviews.title: Good product as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Quite powerful sander. Pad not completely flat, center slight depression, sandpaper on the perimeter wears out except the center. Dust collection could be better. Otherwise for the price, a good product.
customer_reviews.author: CBeh

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sanding cabinets for painting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to rough up my kitchen cabinets to prep them for painting. Its not too heavy and easy to move around. I used it lightly on my surface because I only wanted to take the shine off, but it could easily tackle heavy duty jobs and sand deeper.
customer_reviews.author: KYkari

customer_reviews.title: Finally no swirl marks on the wood!
customer_reviews.text: I've only 1 orbital sander prior to this Bosch and it was great...lasted 12 years and still going. It's a Black & Decker. BUT IT LEFT SWIRL MARKS IN WOOD sometimes. I work with all kinds of wood but primarily pallets. They vary in texture and type. This Bosch does most of the work for me. Seriously, I feel like I'm only barely holding it. Love it's comfortable grip and best part- no swirls.
customer_reviews.author: BinaryCode

customer_reviews.title: this is a work horse and really feels great to use
customer_reviews.text: this is a work horse and really feels great to use. I just refinished our hardwood floors and this doesn't fatigue too much after hours of continual use. It's also not too loud which is nice. When hooked to a vacuum it captured >90% of the dust too. Overall it's great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT but the dust collector seems to be more of ...
customer_reviews.text: Works GREAT but the dust collector seems to be more of a novelty then collecting a lot of dust. It works, you would just think it would work better. The sander itself is GREAT! Just give yourself plenty of ventilation or you will have sawdust everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: ashell

customer_reviews.title: Another Winner
customer_reviews.text: The Bosch ROS20VSK Variable Speed Random Orbital Sander meets all my palm sander requirements. Its efficient, quiet, has minimal vibration transmitted to the hand, comfortably fits the palm, and at about $70 is a bargain for this quality. Other brands of Orbital Sanders do not even come close, in spite of costing three times as much. The Hook and Loop system for sanding media beats everything else for economy and ease of use. Instead of needing three Sanders, one for each progressive grit, this one sander, with variable speed, allows a simple removal and addition of each sanding grit, in seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Old Woodworker

customer_reviews.title: this is the best orbit sander you can buy at this price
customer_reviews.text: Wow! All things considered, this is the best orbit sander you can buy at this price! We have refinished some special family furniture pieces and this sander worked like a dream! Beautiful design, easy to hold, easy to clean and it is a workhorse!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Great value for such a smooth tool
customer_reviews.text: Love the feel and smooth operation. Speed control really makes a nice difference and love that it comes with a vacuum attachment. I was amazed at how well the attached dust collector worked. Dump it frequently! Love this tool!
customer_reviews.author: Rough Rider

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this sander
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this sander. What an improvement from the older Black and Decker I had before. Made short work of the projects I used it on.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Kohl

customer_reviews.title: Low vibration and great dust collection, but difficult to control
customer_reviews.text: I'll start with the Pros: 1. Very low vibration 2. Dust collection is excellent 3. Variable speed Now the cons: 1. I could not control this sander to save my life. It was jumping and pulling me all over the place. My el-cheapo black and decker was easier to control than this model. It's already on it's way back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Bryank930

product_meta.title: BOSCH ROS20VSK Palm Sander - 2.5 Amp 5 in. Corded Variable Speed Random Orbital Sander/Polisher Kit with Dust Collector and Hard Carrying Case, Blue
product_meta.description:
Style:Orbit Sander with CaseThe Bosch ROS20VSK 5" Random Orbit Sander/Polisher furnishes an optimized combination of pad orbit and rotation that delivers fast removal and a well-blended, ultra-smooth finish. This tool is designed to allow finish carpenters and cabinet makers to complete their tasks quickly and to exacting standards, without swirl marks. This sander allows users to find the perfect speed for whatever task they need to complete, with an optimal on-board system for filtering fine dust.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Bosch ROS20VS is designed to give even the most exacting finish carpenters, cabinet makers, woodworkers and others exactly what they want, beginning with great performance and results. The optimized combination of pad orbit and rotation delivers fast removal and a well-blended, ultra-smooth finish. Bosch's integral pad dampening system, a pad braking system, is designed to eliminate the most common complaint of random orbit sander users; swirl marks on the workpiece. Finish quality is further enhanced with the use of a soft microcellular backing pad. The pliable pad ensures a smooth, fine finish on flat or contoured surfaces.
feature_bullets: SMOOTH FINISH: Pad dampening system designed to eliminate swirl marks on both flat and contoured surfaces
EASY DISC ATTACHMENT: Through Bosch's signature Hook and Loop disc attachment system, sanding pads stick to the hand sander, acting like a Velcro-adhesion material
VARIABLE SPEED CONTROL: Powerful 2. 5 AMP motor allows speed to work-piece and task matching with ease.No Load OPM:7,500-12,000

DUST COLLECTION: Features a micro filter system for fine dust and trapping particles as small as a 1/2-micron in diameter. Durable and compact, the dust canister shows dust level and easily detaches for mess-free tasks
KIT CONTENTS: Includes sanding pad, sanding disc, dampening ring, dust canister, vacuum adapter and hard carrying case

specifications.Warranty Description: 30 day money back guarentee, 1 year manufactuer warranty
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,397 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
